etymology.description: 讠(言) (yán, "speech") + 丁(丁) (dīng, "nail") = to fix with words -> order; agree; conclude
etymology.interpretation: The character 订(訂) (dìng, "order; agree; conclude") combines 讠(言) (yán, "speech"), indicating verbal communication, with 丁(丁) (dīng, "nail"), giving the sense of securing or fixing an agreement with words.
etymology.simplification: 訂(訂) simplified by changing 言(言) (yán, "speech") to 讠, a cursive shorthand retaining the meaning of speech.

examples.chinese: 我在餐厅订了一份面条(我在餐廳訂了一份麵條)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài cāntīng dìng le yī fèn miàntiáo.
examples.english: I ordered a serving of noodles at the restaurant.

examples.chinese: 我们订好机票(我們訂好機票)，准备明天出发(準備明天出發)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dìng hǎo jīpiào, zhǔnbèi míngtiān chūfā.
examples.english: We have booked our tickets and are ready to depart tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 经过讨论(經過討論)，双方订立协议(雙方訂立協議)。
examples.english: After discussions, both parties concluded an agreement.
